description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Invoice_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Invoice_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Invoice_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Invoice Type for update only purposes.

Invoice_Type_Data.description: Invoice Type ID. This is the Invoice Type unique identifier.
The name of the Invoice Type

CountryObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CountryObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CountryObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Invoice_Type_Data.description: The country for this Invoice Type. Any country is available to choose. This cannot be edited once the Invoice Type is in use.
The description of the Invoice Type. This is not required.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Unique_IdentifierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Invoice_Type_Data.description: The usage location of the Invoice Type. If this is left blank, the Invoice Type will not be available anywhere. Only in the chosen usage locations will the Invoice Type be available for selection.
This boolean attribute activates or deactivates the Invoice Type. If an Invoice Type in inactive, it will no longer show up in its usage locations.
This field identifies if the invoice type is in use within Workday. The field is only for informational purposes and is ignored by Workday if it's used to submit data.

validation.validation: Enter a unique Invoice Type Value. [Value] is already in use for [Country].
validation.description: The combination of the Invoice Type Name and the related Country must be unique.

validation.validation: The Invoice Type is currently in use, you cannot change the country.
validation.description: The Invoice Type is currently in use, you cannot change the country.
